alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson; Upper Santa Cruz River and Altar Valleys including Nogales (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 24 at 1:27PM MST until October 25 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures ranging from 28 to 32, with isolated locations as low as 26 possible. * WHERE...Colder valley locations east and south of Tucson, including portions of Santa Cruz, Graham, Greenlee, and Cochise counties. Specifically, portions of Upper Santa Cruz River Valley/Altar Valley, Upper San Pedro River Valley, Eastern Cochise County below 5000 feet including the Sulphur Springs Valley, and Upper Gila River Valley. * WHEN...From midnight tonight through 8 AM MST Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
